benchmark_details.name: CondAmbigQA (Conditional Ambiguous Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: CondAmbigQA is a benchmark comprising 2,000 ambiguous queries with condition-aware evaluation metrics to improve accuracy in question-answering tasks by identifying implicit assumptions and providing contextual constraints.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address ambiguity in question-answering by incorporating explicit conditions that help clarify interpretations and enhance answer accuracy.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Despite the promising results, certain types of ambiguity may still be underrepresented.

data.source: Constructed from ambiguous queries and Wikipedia fragments.
data.annotation: Human-LLM interactive annotation with GPT-4o assistance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons of model outputs to the ground-truth answers and conditions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better condition identification and answer accuracy.
methodology.baseline_results: Model performances were evaluated across multiple LLMs, with API models like GPT-4o achieving higher scores than local models.
methodology.validation: The scores correlate strongly with human evaluations.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes a diverse range of ambiguous questions but may not fully represent all demographic contexts.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data is anonymized and does not include personal information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset will be released under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license.
